Compute nr of B per A

Source: R/tidyMS_R6_TransitionCorrelations.R
nr_B_in_A.Rd

Compute nr of B per A

nr_B_in_A(pdata, config, merge = TRUE)

Arguments

pdata

data.frame
config

AnalysisConfiguration

Examples

library(LFQService)
library(tidyverse)
bb <- LFQServiceData::skylinePRMSampleData_A
config <- bb$config_f()
data <- bb$analysis(bb$data, bb$config_f())

#> creating sampleName
#> completing cases
hierarchy <- config$table$hierarchyKeys()
res <- nr_B_in_A(data, config)

#> Column added : nr_peptide_Id_IN_protein_Id
res$data %>% dplyr::select_at(c(config$table$hkeysDepth(),  res$name)) %>% distinct() %>%
  dplyr::pull() %>% table()

#> .
#>  1  2  3  4  5 10 
#> 10  7  3  9  6  2 


bb <- LFQServiceData::skylineSRM_HL_A
config <- bb$config_f()
resDataStart <- bb$analysis(bb$data, bb$config_f())

#> creating sampleName
#> completing cases

nr_B_in_A(resDataStart, config)

#> Column added : nr_peptide_Id_IN_protein_Id
#> $data
#> # A tibble: 5,715 x 12
#>    Replicate.Name sampleName treatment_c time_c Isotope.Label protein_Id

#>  6 04_S172853_lo~ lowG~p06   lowG        p06    heavy         sp|O95477~
#>  7 04_S172853_lo~ lowG~p06   lowG        p06    heavy         sp|O95477~
#>  8 04_S172853_lo~ lowG~p06   lowG        p06    heavy         sp|O95477~

nr_B_in_A(resDataStart, config, merge = FALSE)

config$table$hierarchyDepth <- 2
nr_B_in_A(resDataStart, config, merge = FALSE)
